seed_framework.source: Extended from v1.0 via trolley problem analysis integration, incorporating: conatus harmony dynamics (dξ/dt = ∇logP - ∇ρ - λ∇·S), Fisher information geometry of ethical parameters, quantum-ethical entanglement models, phase transition analysis, and neuroscience validation pathways.

variables.ξ: ethical state vector (position on moral manifold)
variables.ω₃: conatus convergence rate (0-1, higher = more utilitarian)

core_equations.name: Fisher Information Metric
core_equations.equation: gᵢⱼ(θ) = E[∂/∂θᵢ log P(x|θ) · ∂/∂θⱼ log P(x|θ)]

variables.P(x|θ): probability of outcomes given ethical parameters

variables.η: coupling coefficient to physical conatus gradient

definitions.details: Riemannian manifold parameterized by ethical principles θ, equipped with Fisher metric gᵢⱼ(θ); ethical positions are points, decisions are geodesics.
Directional derivative of log survival probability on ethical manifold; represents natural ethical 'striving' toward outcomes that preserve being.
Distance between ethical positions measured by D_F(θ₁,θ₂) = ∫√[gᵢⱼ(θ) dθⁱ dθʲ]; quantifies difference between ethical frameworks.
Sudden change in decision pattern when ethical parameters cross critical values; analogous to physical phase transitions with order parameter ⟨decision⟩.
Non-separable correlation between ethical parameters in composite dilemmas; measured by entanglement entropy S = -Tr(ρ_ethical log ρ_ethical).
Δθ₁·Δθ₂ ≥ 1/(4√det(F)); cannot simultaneously know utilitarian weighting and rights sensitivity beyond Fisher precision.

axioms: All ethical decisions are gradient flows on survival probability manifolds.
Fisher information bounds ethical decision precision (no infinite certainty).
Observer's ethical measurement disturbs both ethical state and physical outcome (ethical Heisenberg principle).
Different ethical frameworks are coordinate systems on same underlying manifold (ethical equivalence principle).

principles.details: Ethical agents follow ∇logP weighted by their Fisher metric; differences in decisions arise from different metrics, not different fundamental principles.
All trolley variants map to regions of same ethical manifold; variants differ in curvature, boundary conditions, or metric components.
Total ethical striving ∑ω₃∇logP_i is conserved in closed ethical systems; transfers between agents via empathy coupling J_ij.
Superpositions of ethical states decohere into classical decisions via interaction with environmental degrees of freedom (social pressure, precedent, etc.).

stages.description: Map decision basins of attraction; identify critical points (∇logP = ∇ρ) and phase boundaries.
stages.recursive_mechanism: Track ethical state trajectories across parameter variations.

stages.description: For ambiguous dilemmas, model ethical state as superposition |Ψ_ethical⟩ = α|decision_A⟩ + β|decision_B⟩; compute decoherence time.
stages.recursive_mechanism: Apply ethical measurement operators until collapse to eigenstate.

stages.description: For social dilemmas, couple ethical states via J_ij terms; simulate consensus formation, polarization, or clustering.
stages.recursive_mechanism: Solve coupled conatus equations for population dynamics.

stages.description: Compare predictions to behavioral data, neural correlates, cultural variations; refine parameters via maximum likelihood on ethical manifold.
stages.recursive_mechanism: Bayesian updates to Fisher metric and conatus parameters.
